content:
• Friday, May 3, 2013
  • ARCB

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: ABFS +16.0%. RNR +3.75%. MSG +3.3%. NCT +3.1%. INCY...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: ABFS +16.0%. RNR +3.75%. MSG +3.3%. NCT +3.1%. INCY +3.0%.
    After-hours top losers: STM -9%. GRMN -3.6%. BRCD -2.7%. H -2.6%. CPWR -2.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:18 PM
  • ELX

    Storage adapter card/switch archrivals Emulex (ELX +2.7%) and QLogic (QLGC -7.4%) went in...

    Storage adapter card/switch archrivals Emulex (ELX +2.7%) and QLogic (QLGC -7.4%) went in opposite directions following their March quarter reports. Emulex, which closed yesterday not far from its 52-week low, outperformed after posting a revenue beat and guiding for FQ4 revenue of $118M-$122M and EPS of $0.11-$0.13; the consensus is at $116.7M and $0.16. QLogic got hammered as its FQ4 beat became overshadowed by FQ1 guidance for revenue of $110M-$116M and EPS of $0.11-$0.16, below a consensus of $116.9M and $0.17. On its earnings call, QLogic mentioned the challenges faced by its server OEM clients were hurting adapter card sales. (ELX transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +5.5%) closed sharply higher today after trading lower AH yesterday in response...

    OpenTable (OPEN +5.5%) closed sharply higher today after trading lower AH yesterday in response to the light revenue guidance accompanying its Q1 report. Healthy business metrics could be a reason: seated diners +25% Y/Y in Q1, up from Q4's 22%, and OpenTable's restaurant base rose by 440 to 27,957. Restaurant revenue +21% Y/Y (same as Q4), subscription revenue +8% (+10% in Q4). International seated diners +37% Y/Y, but revenue only +7%. North American seated diners +24%, revenue (87% of total) +17%. On the earnings call, management noted 36% of NA seated diners originated on a mobile device, up from Q4's 33%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: XLK +3.9%. QQQ +3.7%. EPI +3.6%. EWY +3.2%. ILF +3.1%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: XLK +3.9%. QQQ +3.7%. EPI +3.6%. EWY +3.2%. ILF +3.1%.
    ETF Losers: GAZ -4.6%. UNG -4.2%. VXX -2.8%. GDXJ -2.4%. TLT -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • SMRT

    More on Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT): FQ4 EPS easily beats estimates, with comp sales increasing by...

    More on Stein Mart (NASDAQ:SMRT): FQ4 EPS easily beats estimates, with comp sales increasing by 6% Y/Y. Additionally, the company has restated and refiled Q4 2011 EPS at $0.13, and FY 2011 EPS restated to $0.44. With the FY11 restatement and today's SEC filings, the company says it's regained compliance with NASDAQ rules. Shares -2.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • MTGE

    More on American Capital Mortgage Investment (NASDAQ:MTGE) Q1 earnings: Like sister company AGNC...

    More on American Capital Mortgage Investment (NASDAQ:MTGE) Q1 earnings: Like sister company AGNC (also with Gary Kain as CIO), MTGE reports a big mark-to-market loss ($1.66/share) on agency MBS. Loss partially offset by $0.64 gain on non-agency holdings. Spread income of $0.62 - NIM of 2.01%, off 6 bps from Q4. Book value of $24.25/share, down 5.8% from Dec. 31. Shares -2.3% AH after 3.5% loss in regular session. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 20 Comments
  • BPL

    A project to connect Buckeye Partners' (BPL +5.8%) Perth Amboy, N.J., terminal to a pipeline...

    A project to connect Buckeye Partners' (BPL +5.8%) Perth Amboy, N.J., terminal to a pipeline transportation hub in Linden should be completed by April 2014, three months ahead of schedule, CEO Clark Smith says in today's conference call. Once in Linden, petroleum products transferred from Perth Amboy - which can store 4M-plus barrels - can be sent to BPL's other Northeast delivery points.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • WFT

    Shares of Weatherford (WFT +8%), which reported mixed Q1 results, surge after analysts are told...

    Shares of Weatherford (WFT +8%), which reported mixed Q1 results, surge after analysts are told in today's conference call that H2 should show modest growth in North America revenues and operating income, and plans to improve profitability are taking hold. WFT "did a good job of putting away concerns” such as costs, one analyst says, as it cut capex guidance to 8%-10% of total revenue, down from 8%-12%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • OXY

    Irani is out: LA Times says the longtime Occidental Petroleum (OXY +3.2%) chairman withdraws as...

    Irani is out: LA Times says the longtime Occidental Petroleum (OXY +3.2%) chairman withdraws as a nominee to serve a new term on the board, and is absent from today’s shareholder meeting. It's not known who will become the next chairman, but replacing Irani on the board is Edward Djerejian, a former U.S. ambassador to Israel and an assistant secretary of State. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 3 Comments
  • HL

    Aurizon Mines (AZK -11.8%) CEO George Paspalas says the spill of mine waste at its Casa Berardi...

    Aurizon Mines (AZK -11.8%) CEO George Paspalas says the spill of mine waste at its Casa Berardi gold mine in Quebec doesn’t jeopardize its C$670M takeover by Hecla Mining. The accident is a minor issue, operations at the mine haven’t been interrupted, and "there is no change in the situation."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • BBVA

    Spain's Banco Bilbao (BBVA +0.6%) gives up a the better part of its gains for the day after a...

    Spain's Banco Bilbao (BBVA +0.6%) gives up a the better part of its gains for the day after a downgrade to sell from Citigroup. No details yet, but it could be a valuation call on a stock that's risen more than 80% since last summer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE +2.7%) says it won't play an active role in the change of ownership at Companhia...

    Vale (VALE +2.7%) says it won't play an active role in the change of ownership at Companhia Siderurgica do Atlantico, a loss-making steel mill in Brazil, and plans only to maintain existing supply contracts. Vale owns a 26.87% stake in the JV with ThyssenKrupp, which put its stake up for sale after losing billions of dollars on the projects in recent years. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +3.5%) continues its M&A spree, buying "key technology and talent" from...

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +3.5%) continues its M&A spree, buying "key technology and talent" from former cruise booking site CruiseWise. The assets will be integrated with TripAdvisor's Cruise Critic reviews/bookings site. TripAdvisor bought luxury hotel bookings site Jetsetter.com in April, and travel recommendations sharing site Wanderfly last October. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • AU

    As cheaper gold makes South African mines unprofitable to operate, Goldman Sachs slaps Sell...

    As cheaper gold makes South African mines unprofitable to operate, Goldman Sachs slaps Sell ratings on AngloGold (AU -1.2%) and Sibanye (SBGL -5.1%) due to their high exposure to the country. The firm also thinks attempts to reduce costs by reducing labor or closing mines could be met with strikes or government interference. Goldman's best rating - Neutral - is saved for Randgold (GOLD -0.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • SCOR

    Shares of comScore (SCOR +18.3%) soar after the company beats estimates with its Q1 report. Word...

    Shares of comScore (SCOR +18.3%) soar after the company beats estimates with its Q1 report. Word from execs that the comScore might turn a profit for the full-year as it products gain traction seems to be buoying sentiment along with a couple of analyst upgrades. (earnings call transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +5%) jumps after completing enrollment in a final, pivotal Phase III...

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +5%) jumps after completing enrollment in a final, pivotal Phase III trial for its benign prostatic hyperplasia treatment NX-1207. Previous results suggest the drug may be able to double average symptomatic improvements compared to conventional treatments. (I, II, III)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • FOSL

    Even if Barclays is unsure (Equal-weight) about Fossil (FOSL +2.5%), Topeka is willing to...

    Even if Barclays is unsure (Equal-weight) about Fossil (FOSL +2.5%), Topeka is willing to express some conviction, starting the retailer at Buy with a $112 price target. The company "has a globally recognized portfolio of brands with double-digit top-and bottom-line growth," analyst Dorothy Lakner says, before expressing confidence in FOSL's ability to maintain and expand margins going forward. FOSLÂ is set to report earnings next Tuesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +9.7%) just won't take a breather. Share are now up 42% on the week even though the...

    AMD (AMD +9.7%) just won't take a breather. Share are now up 42% on the week even though the chipmaker hasn't seen any major news and has been hit with a downgrade. Bernstein speculates enthusiasm about AMD's next-gen console design wins is responsible, but they've been well-known for some time. Is a major short-seller or two covering? Is an activist investor moving in? Regardless, shares are up 57% YTD in spite of a pretty ugly Q1 for PC sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 7 Comments
  • VCRA

    Vocera (VCRA -35.4%) slides after earnings and revenue miss expectations. Inconsistent sales...

    Vocera (VCRA -35.4%) slides after earnings and revenue miss expectations. Inconsistent sales execution and increased financial scrutiny from hospital customers (due to "reduced reimbursement rates under reform"), caused "several significant expansion deals" not to be signed, says CEO Bob Zollars. VCRA also lowers its FY13 revenue and EPS guidance to $100-110M and -$0.47 to -$0.22 per share respectively. Previously bullish Leerink Swann downgrades the shares to Market Perform. "It seems like hospitals are going to be facing reimbursement pressure for a long time. That's … a comment rather than a question," analyst David Larsen said on the call. (PR, transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • OKE

    ONEOK Partners (OKS +2.7%) is downgraded to Neutral at Global Hunter after disappointing Q1...

    ONEOK Partners (OKS +2.7%) is downgraded to Neutral at Global Hunter after disappointing Q1 results. Management reiterated 2013 guidance despite the miss, but the firm sees further risk given its view that base business fundamentals are not likely to recover this year; OKS likely faces a continued adjustment to its lower distribution growth outlook in the face of weak NGL fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB -2.1%) roundup: 1) Pivotal Research thinks Q1 results indicate Facebook's FBX ad...

    Facebook (FB -2.1%) roundup: 1) Pivotal Research thinks Q1 results indicate Facebook's FBX ad targeting platform (thus far limited to PCs) is growing slower than hoped. The firm adds some of FBX's top ad agency clients are growing slower than expected. 2) Nielsen estimates U.S. visitors to Facebook's site fell 11M Y/Y in March to 142M. Facebook estimates its North American MAUs (inc. app users) rose 12M Y/Y in Q1 to 195M, but only 2M Q/Q. 52M users were added Q/Q in other markets. 3) Facebook ads can now be sent based on a user's app installs and in-app purchases. 4) Instagram has added a photo-tagging feature; AllThingsD thinks brands could make use of it. Shares seem to be selling off today in sympathy with LinkedIn.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • URI

    Trucking stocks outperform the broad market after the jobs report indicates for-hire trucking...

    Trucking stocks outperform the broad market after the jobs report indicates for-hire trucking firms unexpectedly added 11.7K jobs in April after shedding 6.3K in March. Advancers: United Rentals (NYSE:URI) +7.2%, Ryder Systems (NYSE:R) +4.5%, GATX Corporation (NYSE:GATX) +3.3%, J.B. Hunt Transportation (NASDAQ:JBHT) +1.8%, Knight Transportation (NYSE:KNX) +3.7%, Amerco (NASDAQ:UHAL) +5.0%, Pacer International (NASDAQ:PACR) +4.1%, H&E Equipment Services (NASDAQ:HEES) +5.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • SD

    While TPG-Axon won nearly half the seats on SandRidge Energy's (SD +1.9%) board, it will...

    While TPG-Axon won nearly half the seats on SandRidge Energy's (SD +1.9%) board, it will continue to face an uphill battle to reverse a slumping stock price, a Reuters analysis says. With a sale apparently off the table, SD's future rests on its 2M acres in the Mississippi Lime, but the value of the acreage took a hit when Chesapeake sold some of its stake in the region for far below what analysts had projected.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 11 Comments
  • HCI

    Homeowner's Choice (HCI +16.3%) soars after Q1 results top expectations. The insurer reports EPS...

    Homeowner's Choice (HCI +16.3%) soars after Q1 results top expectations. The insurer reports EPS of $1.81 against analysts' estimates of $1.13 on net premiums totaling $60.6M (+49.8% Y/Y). "Our book of business continues to perform well" says CEO Paresh Patel. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn's (LNKD -9.9%) below-consensus guidance is likely conservative, Goldman declares as the...

    LinkedIn's (LNKD -9.9%) below-consensus guidance is likely conservative, Goldman declares as the company gives back some of its giant 2013 gains. Goldman might be right, but investors have already come to expect big earnings beats. The sell-side is staying positive, arguing long-term growth drivers - strong user growth, recruiting share gains, higher engagement, etc. - remain intact. Not accounting for post-earnings estimate changes, LinkedIn currently trades at 87x 2014E EPS and 9.4x 2014E sales. Considering how share-losing rival Monster (MWW +4.6%) is performing, a strong NFP report may be limiting today's decline. (previous) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum  (SPRD -5.1%) has a rough day ahead of its May 9 Q1 report thanks to a two-notch...

    SpreadtrumÂ  (SPRD -5.1%) has a rough day ahead of its May 9 Q1 report thanks to a two-notch downgrade to Underperform from Japan's Daiwa Capital. The firm expects strong Q1 results and Q2 guidance, but sees a 2H pickup in dual-core TD-SCDMA 3G processor shipments (from MediaTek and Qualcomm?) translating into tougher competition. Shares are still up 17% YTD; they trade at 8.9x 2013E EPS. (CTO firing) (price cut report)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • RDC

    Rowan Companies (RDC +3.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Jefferies, which sees a better...

    Rowan Companies (RDC +3.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Jefferies, which sees a better handle on operations and its review of possible rig projects suggests downtime risk is manageable and 2014 estimates are achievable. As such, the firm says it can refocus on "peer-leading growth prospects" for 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • BX

    Blackstone (BX +4.3%) parties as the company holds its investor day - (webcast) (presentation) -...

    Blackstone (BX +4.3%) parties as the company holds its investor day - (webcast) (presentation) - with global real estate chief Jonathan Grey saying he expects to close a $4B Asia real estate fund (BX's first) this quarter. Performance fees, says CFO Larry Tosi, are set to hit pre-financial crisis levels - when the stock was a whole lot higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 5 Comments
  • OXY

    It's rare for chairmen to lose their jobs, but today's shareholder meeting may mark the end for...

    It's rare for chairmen to lose their jobs, but today's shareholder meeting may mark the end for Occidental Petroleum (OXY +3.4%) Chairman Ray Irani after a nearly 30-year legacy at the oil and gas producer. Irani could wind up with a consulting contract with OXY through the end of 2014, says a person familiar with the board’s thinking, particularly given his Middle East contacts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPEX

    Shares of Spherix (SPEX +33.8%) are notably sweeter after the company signs a MOU with ChromaDex...

    Shares of Spherix (SPEX +33.8%) are notably sweeter after the company signs a MOU with ChromaDex (CDXC +1%) to "optimize a more efficient scalable process for the production of tagatose," a natural sweetener with the same bulk and sweetness as sugar that suffers from a high cost of production. Notable personnel info: CDXC's Troy Rhonemus, previously "the product line lead manager at Cargill Health responsible for managing the operations and supply chain of Truvia," will oversee the effort. ( PR )

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • AGNC

    The upward pressure on rates that caused Q1's losses has reversed, says AGNC CIO Gary Kain on...

    The upward pressure on rates that caused Q1's losses has reversed, says AGNC CIO Gary Kain on the earnings call, andÂ the decline in book value partly reversed in April (don't speak too soon Mr. Kain, the 10-year yield is up 10 bps today). Kain has taken advantage of lower MBS prices to add to the company's portfolio. Prepayments and dollar rolls remained benign in Q1, and Kain expects them to remain so. (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 8 Comments
  • MRK

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +3.2%) outperforms after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $61 PT....

    Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +3.2%) outperforms after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $61 PT. Jim Cramer recently gave a shout-out to the drug developer, which ticked higher in April following its Q1 miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • RDCM

    Radcom (RDCM +52.7%) soars after saying in a PR that its "end-to-end LTE monitoring solution...

    Radcom (RDCM +52.7%) soars after saying in a PR that its "end-to-end LTE monitoring solution will provide service assurance for one of the largest planned LTE deployments in the world." The company (which calls the contract a "major deal") says that given its six LTE contracts, it has established itself as "a leader in the rapidly developing market for LTE monitoring and service assurance solutions."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • AGNC

    American Capital Agency (AGNC -7%) is not far off session lows as the earnings call is set to...

    American Capital Agency (AGNC -7%) is not far off session lows as the earnings call is set to get underway momentarily (webcast) (slides). Anybody selling or short may want to prepare themselves for CIO Gary Kain laying out very clearly how the rise in rates and the large secondary hurt Q1, but that book value has already strongly rebounded in Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 10 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV +10.3%) rips a double-digit gain with enthusiasm building that new management will...

    Navistar (NAV +10.3%) rips a double-digit gain with enthusiasm building that new management will push the right buttons to lead a turnaround. Some insider buying and EPA certification for the company's 13-liter Maxxforce engine is also helping to tip sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • PKT

    Procera's (PKT +31.5%) strong 2013 guidance (provided with its Q1 report) is giving a lift to...

    Procera's (PKT +31.5%) strong 2013 guidance (provided with its Q1 report) is giving a lift to deep packet inspection (DPI) hardware rival Allot (ALLT +4.1%) ahead of it May 7 Q1 report. Needham has upgraded Procera to Strong Buy, citing improved visibility and a belief shares are still oversold; even after today's giant gains, Procera remains down 22% YTD after getting clocked in Feb. due to a Q4 miss and soft guidance. In tandem with its report, Procera announced it has received major orders (I, II) for its PacketLogic DPI systems from a North American cable provider and a Tier-1 European carrier.Â  (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • OUTD

    InterMedia re-raises, upping its bid for Outdoor Channel Holdings (OUTD +5.9%) to $9.75 in cash...

    InterMedia re-raises, upping its bid for Outdoor Channel Holdings (OUTD +5.9%) to $9.75 in cash to top Kroenke's $9.35 bid from yesterday. The action now moves back to Kroenke. The stock's currently at $10.02, suggesting Kroenke isn't about to fold.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 7 Comments
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold (HMY -7.4%) plunges after reporting a surprise quarterly loss as output fell 15% to...

    Harmony Gold (HMY -7.4%) plunges after reporting a surprise quarterly loss as output fell 15% to 247.5K oz., mainly due to the temporary closure of the Kusasalethu mine in South Africa. CEOÂ Graham Briggs says HMY will cut FY 2014 capex by 1.4B rand ($155M), noting "the sudden drop in the gold price requires us to look more carefully at our costs."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • GNW

    Mortgage insurance firms continue a nice run, helped by AIG, where income at its mortgage...

    Mortgage insurance firms continue a nice run, helped by AIG, where income at its mortgage insurance arm (United Guaranty) jumped to $41M from $8M a year ago. On the CC, execs offered a brighter outlook for the business than Genworth (GNW +1.8%) did earlier in the week, reports Erik Holm. In an SA Pro article just released from embargo, SA Pro author Oliver Davies again makes his case for MGIC (MTG +3.8%) over Radian (RDN +3.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • INVN

    Heavily-shorted InvenSense (INVN +25.7%) continues shooting higher after beating FQ4 estimates....

    Heavily-shorted InvenSense (INVN +25.7%) continues shooting higher after beating FQ4 estimates. FQ1 guidance isn't great - revenue of $53M-$55M and EPS of $0.12-$0.14 vs. a consensus of $56.4M and $0.15 - but the motion sensor chipmaker also talked on its CC about a strong backlog and a solid relationship with Samsung, and didn't do anything to shoot down reports of an iPhone 5S design win. Top rival and current iPhone motion sensor supplier STMicroelectronics (STM -0.1%) is missing out on today's rally. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • AXL

    More on American Axle's (AXL +6%) Q1: A "commitment to deliver improved profitability and launch...

    More on American Axle's (AXL +6%) Q1: A "commitment to deliver improved profitability and launch performance globally," results in strong Q1 revenues that beat analysts' estimates even after a labor strike at GM's Rayong factory in Thailand subtracted ~$12.5M from total sales. Content-per-vehicle rises to $1,504 from $1,475 in Q1 2012. 2013's primary focus: the "flawless" launch of products "supporting GM's next-generation full-size pickup truck and SUV program [and] the RAM heavy duty pickup truck program." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • EQT

    EQT Corp. (EQT +1.9%) agrees to buy ~99K net acres in western Pennsylvania and 10 horizontal...

    EQT Corp. (EQT +1.9%) agrees to buy ~99K net acres in western Pennsylvania and 10 horizontal Marcellus wells from Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1%) for ~$113M, marking CHK's third announced asset sale this week. Three of the 10 wells are producing, EQT says the remaining seven will be turned in line by year-end 2013, adding ~1B cfe of sales volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • YGE

    Chinese solar stocks slump as Reuters reports EU trade chief Karl De Gucht is set to recommend...

    Chinese solar stocks slump as Reuters reports EU trade chief Karl De Gucht is set to recommend import tariffs be placed on Chinese solar panels in the wake of an anti-dumping probe. European solar module demand has been weak for a while thanks to subsidy cuts and macro issues, but still accounts for a giant chunk of the global market. EU tariffs have been expected for some time, and the Chinese government might return fire by placing tariffs on polysilicon import from the EU and elsewhere. YGE -4.8%. CSIQ -3.3%. SOL -2.8%. TSL -2.6%. (U.S. tariffs)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • HIL

    Hill International (HIL +18.7%) posts double-digit gains after Thursday's earnings report....

    Hill International (HIL +18.7%) posts double-digit gains after Thursday's earnings report. Consolidated fee revenue increased 23.5% Y/Y to a record $122.6M, operating profit was $4.7M (compared to a $2.7M loss last year) and EBITDA rose a ridiculous 2,479.9%. "We had a much-improved Q1 this year," CEO Irvin Richter said flatly. "Strong revenue growth" and cost minimization have earnings "headed in the right direction," he added. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • OIS

    Oil States International (OIS +2.2%) bows to pressure from top shareholder Jana Partners and...

    Oil States International (OIS +2.2%) bows to pressure from top shareholder Jana Partners and says it will consider spinning off its accommodations business, possibly via a REIT. The unit, which provides housing for energy industry workers in remote locations in Canada, the U.S. and Australia, accounted for ~25% of OIS' 2012 revenue of $4.41B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -48.9%) collapses after the FDA votes unanimously against the...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -48.9%) collapses after the FDA votes unanimously against the company's Melblez Kit, as the risks purportedly outweigh the benefits. The shares were halted Thursday pending the announcement. DCTH is the second casualty of this week's Oncologic Drugs Advisory Board, as Aveo Pharmaceuticals (AVEO +1.5%) received a similarly disappointing panel vote on Tivozanib. (Background: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • GM

    Is it all about China? General Motors (GM +3.6%) trades higher after the impact of China on the...

    Is it all about China? General Motors (GM +3.6%) trades higher after the impact of China on the automaker's Q1 results starts to get fully digested. Barclays notes China accounted for $0.40 of the $0.58 profit GM put in during Q1, while Detroit Free Press reporter Nathan Bomey tabuluated GM sold more cars in China than Europe, South America, India, Canada, and Mexico combined.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM | 4 Comments
  • BPL

    Buckeye Partners (BPL +5.4%) surges at the open following a strong Q1 earnings beat, as higher...

    Buckeye Partners (BPL +5.4%) surges at the open following a strong Q1 earnings beat, as higher pipelines and terminals revenue helped mitigate weaker energy services revenue, which fell 6.7% to $962M. Pipelines and terminals revenue rose 17% to $194M. Operating margin improved to 8.9% from 6.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • PBI

    Pitney Bowes (PBI +8.2%) gains after the company's CEO says during his presentation at Analyst...

    Pitney Bowes (PBI +8.2%) gains after the company's CEO says during his presentation at Analyst Day that he will buy $1M worth of stock. The title of the talk was "Unlocking Value" which almost tells the story on what the company plans to do all by itself. (webcast, slides .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • YRCW

    YRC Worldwide (NASDAQ:YRCW) jumps 28% at the open after posting positive operating income in Q1...

    YRC Worldwide (NASDAQ:YRCW) jumps 28% at the open after posting positive operating income in Q1 for the first time in more than half a decade; Q1 operating income was $2.4M, a $58.5M Y/Y increase. "2013 is a year of performance," CEO James Welch boldly states, adding that the company "still has significant opportunity for… improvements."
